result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 203 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution is requested in the amount of $5,000 (payable to Town Bank).  Defense is contesting the restitution amount and requests a restitution hearing.  Restitution is ordered in the amount of $780 (payable to Town Bank).  To be paid BEFORE costs/fines as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
AMENDED 02-17-2016:  Court orders additional resitution in the amount of $1,860, payable to Town Bank.  To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prison wages or trust account).  Court orders any monies being held by the City of Waukesha P. D. be returned to both Town Bank and Tri City Bank respectively.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with Tri City Bank or Town Bank listed in the criminal complaint or any of their employees.
AMENDED 09-14-2016:  References of absolute sobriety or alcohol related conditions have been removed.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 203 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Count 1.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant Thomas M Clark in court, by phone from DCI with attorney Robert Penegor.  

State and Defense have reached an agreement.
State placed the agreement on the record (there are monies that were being held by the City of Waukesha P.D).
Therefore, the amount of restitution requested is:  $1,860.
Defense/defendant are in agreement to that amount.

Court orders additional restitution in the amount of $1,860 to be paid to Town Bank.
To be payable as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages or trust account).
Court orders any monies being held by the City of Waukesha P.D. be returned to both Town Bank and Tri City Bank respectively.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing at 02-17-2016 03:00 pm
Received and filed in court by the State.
Several Character Letters, received and filed in court.

Barbara Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Thomas M Clark in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J. Penegor.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's father and brother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 25 Years.
Initial Confinement:  15 Years.
Extended Supervision: 10 Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 2
203 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Tri City Bank or Town Bank listed in the complaint or any of their employees.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION Requested:  $5,000 (to be paid to Town Bank - Restitution to be paid first then costs/surcharges).
Defense is contesting the restitution amount and requests a restitution hearing.

Restitution ordered:  $780 (to be paid to Town Bank - Restitution to be paid first then costs/surcharges).
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (to include prison wages or trust accounts).

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  





Count 2:
Total Prison:  25 Years.
Initial Confinement:  15 Years.
Extended Supervision:  10 Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
203 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $268
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (to include prison wages or trust accounts).

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Thomas M Clark in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas M Clark in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Boese is ready to commence the preliminary hearing today, however needs an adjournment for an additional witness to appear.  No objection from Attorney Rosario to commence the hearing today and continue the preliminary hearing.   Waukesha County Detective Shawn Friedbacher sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Boese.  Cross examination by Attorney Rosario.  Redirect by Attorney Boese.  Based on the testimony provided in court today, the state rests and moves for bind over.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
